gdi.ws0809.test
Interface SokobanTest

All Known Implementing Classes:
SokobanTestAdapter
public interface SokobanTest

All public unit tests access your implementation using methods of this interface exclusively. You have to provide an implementation of SokobanTestAdapter to map the methods of this interface to you implementation.

Author:
daniel, Steven Arzt

Method Detail

loadLevel

void loadLevel(java.io.File lvl)
               throws java.lang.Exception
Load a level and parse it into the internal representation. The loaded level is now the and should e.g. be shown in the GUI.

Parameters:
lvl - The file from which to load the level
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - in case the level is not syntactically correct

moveWorker

void moveWorker(char direction)
Move the worker according to the rules. The direction to move is either right, left, up or down, encoded as 'R','L','U' or 'D'.

Parameters:
direction - The encoded direction to move the worker

setLevelDir

void setLevelDir(java.io.File levelDir)
Load a set of levels from a directory. The levels should be sorted alphabetically. It should not load the first level yet. Loading the first level should only happen after a call to startNextLevel().

Parameters:
levelDir - the directory from which to load the levels

startNextLevel

void startNextLevel()
                    throws java.lang.Exception
The next level in a set of levels loaded with loadLevelDir becomes the current level. If there is no more level left, an exception may be thrown.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

getStepsInCurrentLevel

int getStepsInCurrentLevel()
Return the steps performed in the current level, since the last restart of the level. Remember that only the legal moves count.

Returns:
performed steps.

writeHighScoreFile

void writeHighScoreFile()
Tells the Sokoban implementation to write the current highscores to disk, as detailed in the documentation.

void setPlayerName(java.lang.String name)
Set the player name used for highscores.

Parameters:
name - The player name.

boolean isCrateAt(int i,
                  int j)
Gets whether there is a crate at the position identified by the specified X and Y coordinate

Parameters:
i - The X coordinate of the grid position to check
j - The Y coordinate of the grid position to check
Returns:
True if there is a crate at the specified position, otherwise false

canMoveCrate

boolean canMoveCrate(int i,
                     int j,
                     char c)
Checks whether the crate at position (x, y) can be moved in direction c

Parameters:
i - The x coordinate of the crate to check
j - The y coordinate of the crate to check
c - The direction in which the crate move shall be tested
Returns:
True if the crate at the specified position can be moved in the given direction, otherwise false

getBestPlayerName

java.lang.String getBestPlayerName()
Gets the name of the best player (the one with with the least moves) over all levels. If Player A has completed level L1 with 10 moves and level L2 with 15 moves and player B has completed level L2 with 11 moves, the correct return value would be "A" as he has achieved to complete a level with only 10 moves. If the highscore list is empty, an empty string shall be returned.

Returns:
The name of the player with the least moves

clearHighscoreList

void clearHighscoreList()
Clears the highscore list. You can either remove all entries from the "highscore.txt" file or remove the whole file. If there is no highscore file at the moment, nothing should happen.

createHighscoreEntry

boolean createHighscoreEntry(java.lang.String playername,
                             int i,
                             int j,
                             int k)
Creates a new entry in the highscore list if the given data describes a new highscore entry. If the specified entry already exists or has too many steps to be a highscore, nothing happens and false is returned.

Parameters:
playername - The name of the player that has achieved the score
i - A unique number identifying the level in which the score has been reached
j - The count of moves the player has needed to complete the specified level
k - The time the player has needed to solve the level in seconds
Returns:
True if a new entry in the highscore list has been created, otherwise false

getHighscoreCount

int getHighscoreCount()
Gets the count of entries in the highscore list

Returns:
The count of entries in the highscore list

undoLastMove

void undoLastMove()
                  throws java.lang.Exception
Undo the last move. If no move can be undone (e.g. no move has been performed) an Exception is thrown.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception - notifying the client that no move could be undone

redoLastUndoneMove

void redoLastUndoneMove()
                        throws java.lang.Exception
Redo the last undone move. If no move can be redone (e.g. no move has been undone) an Exception is thrown.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception - notifying the client that no move could be redone

saveGame

void saveGame(java.io.File f)
Save the current game state to the File.

Parameters:
f - the file to save the game state in.

loadGame

void loadGame(java.io.File f)
Save the current game state to the File.

Parameters:
f - the file to save the game state in.

isDeadlock

boolean isDeadlock()
Returns whether the current level is in a deadlock position.

Returns:
returns whether the current level is in a deadlock position.

moveWorkerSequence

void moveWorkerSequence(java.lang.String Sequence)
Moves the worker with the steps specified in the move sequence string which needs to be in the RLUD format.

Parameters:
Sequence - The move sequence in the RLUD format
